channel.title: Interface[PI]
channel.description:
Is there anyway i can add a random event to when people are clicking on stalls to prevent an auto clicker. If can anyone could help me out that would be great. Thanks [code]c.getPA().movePlayer(3105, 3495, 0); c.sendMessage("Thieving random."); return;[/code]
Theres the code i want it to open an interface the interace is 16135

item.title: Interface[PI]
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

Spoonfeeding and providing an explanation of what to do next are very different things.

Read full topic

item.title: Interface[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

[quote=“ranger squad, post:14, topic:387302”]Basically, all you did was define a random number. That’s like posting on a topic saying ‘how do I change the whips max hit to 15?’ with this:

It does not help. At all.[/quote]

Sorry, My bad, I guess I was just led to believe that we are NOT a spoon-feeding community, Oh well, Guess that’s my fault for reading the rules

Read full topic

item.title: Interface[PI]
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

Basically, all you did was define a random number. That’s like posting on a topic saying ‘how do I change the whips max hit to 15?’ with this:

It does not help. At all.

item.title: Interface[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Ashton51 link=topic=483102.msg3539292#msg3539292 date=1300748112]

And how exactly would I random integer have anything to do with the timing, or know that you’re thieving, etc?

When you thieve then theres a random chance of the random event interface popping up, since they are RANDOM events, not timed events.
[/quote]I never said timed events. I said timing of the events. As in it will appear on random occasions but not every click, etc.

All you’re doing is giving him a random integer, it has nothing to do with the thieving or interface itself.[/quote]
That’s all you need to know to easily add a little random feature to your thieving method, so every time you thieve it randomizes an integer and when that integer is a certain number, then the interface will pop up

Read full topic

item.title: Interface[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

I Vain I:

And how exactly would I random integer have anything to do with the timing, or know that you’re thieving, etc?

When you thieve then theres a random chance of the random event interface popping up, since they are RANDOM events, not timed events.

Read full topic

item.title: Interface[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Ashton51 link=topic=483102.msg3538400#msg3538400 date=1300684160]

public static int random(int range) return (int)(java.lang.Math.random() * (range+1));
[/quote]What exactly does a random integer have to do with a random event?[/quote]

He wants to make an interface pop up randomly while thieving, I’m not a Java expert but that’s how I would do it.

Read full topic

item.title: Interface[PI]
item.dc:creator: @InsigniaX InsigniaX
item.description:
@InsigniaX wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:8, topic:387302”]Many of the newer PI servers have precautions in place already. Here is a common one,

[code]public int pieSelect = 0;
public int kebabSelect = 0;
public int chocSelect = 0;
public int bagelSelect = 0;
public int triangleSandwich = 0;
public int specRestore = 0;
public int squareSandwich = 0;
public int breadSelect = 0;

public void randomEvent() {
getPA().sendFrame126(" ", 16131);
getPA().showInterface(16135);
int randomMessage = Misc.random(6);
if(randomMessage == 0) {
getPA().sendFrame126(“Please select the pie for a cash reward!”, 16145);
pieSelect = 1;
} else if (randomMessage == 1) {
getPA().sendFrame126(“Please select the kebab for a cash reward!”, 16145);
kebabSelect = 1;
} else if (randomMessage == 2) {
getPA().sendFrame126(“Please select the chocolate for a cash reward!”, 16145);
chocSelect = 1;
} else if (randomMessage == 3) {
getPA().sendFrame126(“Please select the bagel for a cash reward!”, 16145);
bagelSelect = 1;
} else if (randomMessage == 4) {
getPA().sendFrame126(“Please select the triangle sandwich for a cash reward!”, 16145);
triangleSandwich = 1;
} else if (randomMessage == 5) {
getPA().sendFrame126(“Please select the square sandwich for a cash reward!”, 16145);
squareSandwich = 1;
} else if (randomMessage == 6) {
getPA().sendFrame126(“Please select the bread for a cash reward!”, 16145);
breadSelect = 1;
}
}[/code][/quote]
loveandpower where do i put that im kinda new

Read full topic

item.title: Interface[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Many of the newer PI servers have precautions in place already. Here is a common one,

[code]public int pieSelect = 0;
public int kebabSelect = 0;
public int chocSelect = 0;
public int bagelSelect = 0;
public int triangleSandwich = 0;
public int specRestore = 0;
public int squareSandwich = 0;
public int breadSelect = 0;

public void randomEvent() {
getPA().sendFrame126(" ", 16131);
getPA().showInterface(16135);
int randomMessage = Misc.random(6);
if(randomMessage == 0) {
getPA().sendFrame126(“Please select the pie for a cash reward!”, 16145);
pieSelect = 1;
} else if (randomMessage == 1) {
getPA().sendFrame126(“Please select the kebab for a cash reward!”, 16145);
kebabSelect = 1;
} else if (randomMessage == 2) {
getPA().sendFrame126(“Please select the chocolate for a cash reward!”, 16145);
chocSelect = 1;
} else if (randomMessage == 3) {
getPA().sendFrame126(“Please select the bagel for a cash reward!”, 16145);
bagelSelect = 1;
} else if (randomMessage == 4) {
getPA().sendFrame126(“Please select the triangle sandwich for a cash reward!”, 16145);
triangleSandwich = 1;
} else if (randomMessage == 5) {
getPA().sendFrame126(“Please select the square sandwich for a cash reward!”, 16145);
squareSandwich = 1;
} else if (randomMessage == 6) {
getPA().sendFrame126(“Please select the bread for a cash reward!”, 16145);
breadSelect = 1;
}
}[/code]

Read full topic
